body:
Also, there is an internal class in Mono that determine whether on MacOSX

https://github.com/mono/mono/blob/master/mcs/class/System/System/Platform.cs

Thanks for the info. I am setting up a Mac for iOS work, so will take a
look at this when it is ready.
On Feb 23, 2015 11:24 PM, "Chris Hubbard" notifications@github.com wrote:

> Also, there is an internal class in Mono that determine whether on MacOSX
> 
> https://github.com/mono/mono/blob/master/mcs/class/System/System/Platform.cs
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/nunit/nunit/issues/515#issuecomment-75697432.

issue.title: Change platform-specific properties to support Mac

repository.name: libpalaso
repository.description: Palaso Library: A set of .Net libraries useful for developers of Language Software.

issue.body:
- Add Platform.IsMac and Platform.IsUnix (and Unit Tests)
- Change Platform.IsLinux to return true for ONLY Linux (this should
  have been Platform.IsUnix)
- Change implementation that used Platform.IsLinux to use
  Platform.IsUnix (not used in chorus, wesay, or fieldworks)
- Change calls to stat to use correct flags for Mac and Linux
- NUnit 2.6.2 added MacOsX to PlatformAttribute's supported
  platforms, however Mono doesn't return MacOsX for
  Environment.OSVersion.Platform so the NUnit implementation
  doesn't work (https://github.com/nunit/nunit/issues/515).
  Therefore UnitTests that run only on Mac have to use a
  compile-time conditional.
  See Palaso.Tests/PlatformUtilities/PlatformTests.cs for
  how system-specific conditionals are defined.

body: We are still using NUnit 2.6.4 for our projects.  Could I submit a PR for nunitv2?

Please do. You should submit it to the nunitv2 project, of course, not this
one. If it looks good, we'll merge it but it's unlikely that it will ever
see a binary release. NUnit 2.6.4 is currently the last binary release we
plan - although that could always change.

Of course, we'll probably also port the fix to NUnit 3.0, which will gain
it wider use. Be aware that the fix has to work on all our platforms,
including Windows and Linux, Mono and .NET. The checks need to be done at
run time, since we don't do separate builds for those platforms. For
Silverlight and CF, they should be conditioned out, since neither of those
builds can be run on a Mac.

On Wed, Mar 4, 2015 at 6:23 AM, Chris Hubbard notifications@github.com
wrote:

> We are still using NUnit 2.6.4 for our projects. Could I submit a PR for
> nunitv2?
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/nunit/nunit/issues/515#issuecomment-77165663.

Correction: the comments about Silverlight and CF only apply to NUnit 3.0.

On Wed, Mar 4, 2015 at 10:01 AM, Charlie Poole charliepoole@gmail.com
wrote:

> Please do. You should submit it to the nunitv2 project, of course, not
> this one. If it looks good, we'll merge it but it's unlikely that it will
> ever see a binary release. NUnit 2.6.4 is currently the last binary release
> we plan - although that could always change.
> 
> Of course, we'll probably also port the fix to NUnit 3.0, which will gain
> it wider use. Be aware that the fix has to work on all our platforms,
> including Windows and Linux, Mono and .NET. The checks need to be done at
> run time, since we don't do separate builds for those platforms. For
> Silverlight and CF, they should be conditioned out, since neither of those
> builds can be run on a Mac.
> 
> On Wed, Mar 4, 2015 at 6:23 AM, Chris Hubbard notifications@github.com
> wrote:
> 
> > We are still using NUnit 2.6.4 for our projects. Could I submit a PR for
> > nunitv2?
> > 
> > —
> > Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> > https://github.com/nunit/nunit/issues/515#issuecomment-77165663.
It should probably not be commented out, but should be conditioned to return false?  That is what I currently do in my CF build.

As I said, it doesn't really apply to NUnit 2.6.4, which is what he is working on. 

When we get to 3.0, any special code for unix, such as the uname call, should be conditioned out of the CF build.

IsMacOSX and IsXbox don't even exist in our current 3.0 CF build. You're welcome to create a fix that makes them return false as in your private build.
